bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 153 (Thursday, September 22, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. KILMER:H.R. 8967.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, clause 1 provides Congress with thepower to ``lay and collect Taxes, Duties, Imposts andExcises'' in order to ``provide for the . . . general Welfareof the United States.''[Page H8114]

item.title: Puyallup Tribe of Indians Land Into Trust Confirmation Act of 2022

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Puyallup Tribe of Indians Land Into Trust Confirmation Act of 2022

This bill takes approximately 17.264 acres of specified lands in Pierce County, Washington, into trust for the benefit of the Puyallup Tribe of the Puyallup Reservation. Lands taken into trust shall be part of the tribe's reservation.

bill.title: Puyallup Tribe of Indians Land Into Trust Confirmation Act of 2022

item.title: Puyallup Tribe of Indians Land Into Trust Confirmation Act of 2022
Puyallup Tribe of Indians Land Into Trust Confirmation Act of 2022
To take certain land in the State of Washington into trust for the benefit of the Puyallup Tribe of the Puyallup Reservation, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
